statement: Critic passes are mandatory per evidence item with standardized naming, and rubric/score acceptance is gated by regex parser success; failures are durable with explicit error states and retry policies.
rationale: User requires per-evidence critics and staged batching; acceptance gating by regex parsing is the criterion for rubric and score validity.
keyAssumptions: Regex parsers are stable and cover all expected response formats.
validationCriteria: Blueprint defines parser-gated acceptance and error handling for rubric_critic and score_critic outputs.
critiquePoints: Regex-only validation may be brittle across providers; fallback parsing or repair may be needed.
questions: Should failed parses be retried with a repair prompt or simply re-run generation?
What is the max retry budget per item?
